result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle R Orr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court does not object to transfer to Milwaukee County if accepted.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Walmart to be paid as a condition of probation, before costs and fees.
Standard court costs waived.  DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Not to use or possess any vaping or CBD products.    Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Thinking for a Change Class through Agent.  No contact with Walmart.  No operation of a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.  

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight time.  Stayed, to be used at agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Hearing on May 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

03:35 PM Defendant Kyle R Orr appeared by Zoom from Dodge Correctional, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang who appeared by Zoom.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant to appear by Zoom from Dodge Correctional at the next hearing.  Attorney Wang will contact the Court if the defendant is transported before the next date.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart listed in the Criminal Complaint.
